headline: KAL’s cartoon

children.data: Dig deeper into the subject of this week’s cartoon:
Why isn’t America’s gun-control movement more effective?
A spate of gun violence shows American exceptionalism at its worst
Gun groups have their own ideas for preventing mass shootings
KAL’s cartoon appears weekly in The Economist. You can see last week’s

bodyText:
Dig deeper into the subject of this week’s cartoon:
Why isn’t America’s gun-control movement more effective?
A spate of gun violence shows American exceptionalism at its worst
Gun groups have their own ideas for preventing mass shootings

KAL’s cartoon appears weekly in The Economist. You can see last week’s here.

parts.description: How we saw the world

parts.headline: Why the China-US contest is entering a new and more dangerous phase
parts.description: Chinese officials rage at what they see as American bullying

parts.headline: How to fix the global rice crisis
parts.description: The world’s most important crop is fuelling climate change and diabetes

parts.headline: Out of crisis, Israel has the chance to forge a new constitution
parts.description: The government’s retreat has pulled Israel back from the brink. But its people remain deeply divided

parts.headline: America risks propping up zombie banks
parts.description: The banking crisis may have calmed, but only because of a government backstop

parts.headline: The Scottish National Party’s limitations have been laid bare
parts.description: Will Humza Yousaf learn the right lessons?

parts.headline: Letters to the editor
parts.subheadline: On colonialism, planting trees, Taiwan, Japan and South Korea, megaprojects, the Moon, Bibi

_metadata.articleBody:
Dig deeper into the subject of this week’s cartoon:
Why isn’t America’s gun-control movement more effective?
A spate of gun violence shows American exceptionalism at its worst
Gun groups have their own ideas for preventing mass shootings

KAL’s cartoon appears weekly in The Economist. You can see last week’s here.
